definition[0]: a small object at the end of a wire that is used for connecting a piece of electrical equipment to the main supply of electricity
example[0]: The plug on my iron needs changing.
definition[1]: a place on a wall where electrical equipment can be connected to the main electricity supply
definition[2]: a round flat piece of rubber used for stopping the water flowing out of a bath or sink
definition[3]: a way of advertising a book, film etc by mentioning it publicly, especially on television or radio
example[3]: During the show she managed to put in a plug for her new book.
definition[4]: the part of a petrol engine that makes a spark, which makes the petrol start burning
definition[5]: an object or substance that is used to fill or block a hole, tube etc
example[5]: You can fill any holes with plugs of matching wood.
definition[6]: a small plastic tube put in a hole to hold a screw tightly
definition[7]: a piece of something pressed tightly together
definition[8]: to fill or block a small hole
example[7]: We used mud to plug up the holes in the roof.
definition[9]: to advertise a book, film etc by mentioning it on television or radio
example[8]: Arnie was on the show to plug his new movie.
definition[11]: an attempt to persuade people to buy a book, see a film etc by talking about it publicly, especially on television or radio
example[9]: She appeared on all the talk shows to give her new show a plug.
example[10]: The authorput in a plug for his new book.
definition[12]: to prevent a plan or business from being able to continue, especially by not providing any more money
example[11]: We were doing fine until the bank pulled the plug on us.
